timberRidge.title: Timber Ridge Recreation
timberRidge.content: Nestled near Lake Michigan at the base of the east arm of Grand Traverse Bay, Timber Ridge RV & Recreation Resort boasts a charming location bordering Pere Marquette State Forest. With eight basic cabins, 10 deluxe cabins, and 15 full-service cottages, it's an ideal year-round haven for weekend getaways, family reunions, or retirement parties. In summer, revel in the swimming pool, nature trails, playground, family activities, and more. Winter brings heated cabins, cross-country ski rentals, access to a lodge and kitchen, and direct entry to groomed snowmobile trails. Just 10 minutes from downtown Traverse City, this peaceful retreat offers over 200 clean campsites, resort-quality facilities, and additional perks like barbecue grills, a camp store, and laundry facilities.
timberRidge.checkOutTime: 12:00 PM (A late fee of $25 will apply for any late check-outs)
timberRidge.cancellationPolicy: A $15 processing fee applies to all cancellations. You may cancel up to 30 days prior to arrival for a refund, minus the fee. Reservations canceled within 30 days of arrival are non-refundable. Rescheduling is permitted within the same calendar year.

leelanauPines.title: Leelanau Pines Campground
leelanauPines.content: Located on the picturesque shores of Lake Leelanau, Leelanau Pines Campground is a prime spot for waterfront camping. Tent sites offer stunning lake views and direct access to the water, making it a haven for boating, fishing, and water sports enthusiasts. Campers rave about the peaceful sunrise views over the lake, and the campground’s proximity to the wineries of Leelanau Peninsula adds a perfect touch for those looking to indulge in local culture.
leelanauPines.distanceToTown: 15 minutes from Suttons Bay, 20 minutes from downtown Leland, and 25 minutes from Traverse City
leelanauPines.cancellationPolicy: If you cancel your reservation more than 2 weeks in advance, you will receive a refund minus a $25 cancellation fee per campsite, or full refund issued as camp credit. For cancellations made at least 1 week in advance, you will receive 50% of the reservation as camp credit, with the other 50% forfeited. If you cancel less than 1 week before your arrival, the full reservation amount will be forfeited. For changes to your reservation, if you make adjustments to your arrival or departure dates more than 2 weeks in advance, you are allowed one courtesy change. However, any subsequent changes will incur a $15 service fee.

indianRiver.title: Indian River RV Resort
indianRiver.content: Indian River Resort offers a serene escape along Michigan's beautiful Inland Waterway, just a short distance from Mackinac Island. Tent sites are surrounded by lush forests and situated along tranquil riverbanks, providing campers with easy access to kayaking and canoeing. This campground is a popular choice for outdoor enthusiasts, with ample opportunities for water-based activities as well as nearby hiking and ATV trails. The soothing sounds of the flowing river create a peaceful ambiance, making it an ideal spot to unwind after a day of exploration in the stunning surrounding parks.
indianRiver.distanceToTown: 5 minutes from downtown Indian River, 20 minutes from Cheboygan, 28 minutes from Mackinaw City (Port to head to Mackinac Island)
amenities: Nearby Burt Lake State Park with hiking trails and sandy beaches
indianRiver.cancellationPolicy: All reservations require a deposit of the first night's stay (10% for 7-day reservations). A $20 cancellation fee applies if you cancel more than 30 days in advance; if you cancel between 8 and 30 days, your deposit will be held as a credit for 12 months. No refunds or credits will be issued for cancellations within a week of arrival or after check-in. Please note that changes to your reservation may result in increased nightly rates.

fakePlace.title: Mackinac Island Placeholder
fakePlace.content: This is a placeholder for Mackinac City.

uncleDucky.title: Uncle Ducky's - Paddlers Village
uncleDucky.content: Uncle Ducky's in Munising is your gateway to the breathtaking beauty of Michigan's Upper Peninsula, located on the shores of Lake Superior. This campground is famous for its Pictured Rocks kayaking tours, offering campers a unique chance to explore one of Michigan’s most iconic natural wonders. Tent sites are located just steps from the lake, and the stunning views of Superior, combined with easy access to outdoor adventures, make this a favorite for nature lovers.
uncleDucky.distanceToTown: 15 minutes from Munising, with access to shops, restaurants, and Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore.
uncleDucky.cancellationPolicy: A standard $25 cancellation fee applies to all reservations. You may cancel without additional penalties up to 14 days before your arrival date. Cancellations made within 14 days will incur the cancellation fee plus the cost of one full night’s stay. Unfortunately, reservations canceled within 72 hours of check-in will not receive a refund.

touristPark.title: Tourist Park Campground
touristPark.content: Located in Munising, Tourist Park Campground offers a perfect balance of convenience and natural beauty, with tent sites situated along the shores of the Anna River. This peaceful park is a great option for those looking to explore the wonders of Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore while being close to town. Campers can enjoy fishing, kayaking, and easy access to nearby waterfalls and hiking trails. Tourist Park is also ideal for those wanting a quiet, laid-back atmosphere after a day of exploring the Upper Peninsula.
touristPark.distanceToTown: 5 minutes from downtown Munising, offering shops, restaurants, and access to Pictured Rocks.
touristPark.cancellationPolicy: All cancellations made 3 days or more before your arrival will incur a $20 fee. Cancellations occurring within 72 hours of your arrival will be charged 50% of the current reservation cost. For one-night stays, the full amount for that night will be billed.

fortSuperior.title: Fort Superior Campground
fortSuperior.content: Fort Superior Campground is a hidden gem located near Munising, offering a unique camping experience surrounded by dense forests and rugged landscapes. This more rustic campground may require some walking to reach your site, but the breathtaking views of Lake Superior make it worthwhile. Perfect for those seeking solitude and a deeper connection with nature, campers enjoy direct access to the lake, ideal for fishing, kayaking, and soaking in the stunning scenery. The campground is also conveniently situated near several historical sites, including the famous Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore, making it an excellent base for outdoor adventures.
fortSuperior.distanceToTown: 10 minutes from downtown Munising, where you can find shops, restaurants, and access to Pictured Rocks.
fortSuperior.guidelines: 6 Guests Maximum Per Site, 2 vehicles per site
fortSuperior.cancellationPolicy: Full payment is required at the time of reservation, and all cancellations or changes must be submitted via email to fortsuperiorcampground@gmail.com. A $25 cancellation fee applies for cancellations made up to two weeks prior to check-in; within two weeks, the fee is $25 plus one full night’s stay. No refunds will be issued for cancellations within three days of check-in or for early check-outs, and credit card processing fees are non-refundable.
